parameters.description: An access token identifies a collection of APIs belonging to an API client.
parameters.name: accessToken

get.summary: Get a client by its access token
get.description: View an API client's details. This operation lets you get a specific API client by passing the client's token in the request.

parameters.description: Includes actions you can perform on the object, `false` by default.
parameters.name: actions

200.description: The response provides API client's details.

schema.description: This object encapsulates the response schema for creating API client.

authorization.description: An API client's combination of services and grant scopes that allow you to make calls with that client.

accessToken.description: Part of the client secret that identifies your API client and lets you access applications and resources. Tokens are unique per client.

baseURL.description: The base URL for the service.

ccuParams.description: Fast Purge (CCU) details, applicable only for users with Fast Purge enabled.

purgeByCacheTag.description: If `purgeByCacheTag` is `true` you can purge by cache tag with your API client.

purgeByCpcode.description: If `purgeByCpCode` is `true` you can purge that CP code with your API client.

purgeCpcodes.description: Lists all CP codes that your API client is allowed to purge.

description.description: Description of the API client's authorization.

openIdentityId.description: Unique identifier for an API client.

serviceProviderId.description: A unique identifier for a service provider.

serviceProviderName.description: The name of the service provider, like DNS or CCU.

services.description: Lists APIs you'd like to use, like Property Manager.

endPoint.description: The endpoint to access a service.

grantScopes.description: The amount of access you give to an API client on a per-service basis.

description.description: The description of a grant scope.

name.description: The name of a grant scope.

serviceId.description: A unique identifier for a service.

serviceName.description: The name of a service, like Edge Diagnostics, or Identity Management: API.

groupName.description: The human-readable name for a group.

isBlocked.description: If `true`, the API client has access to the group's parent, but cannot access the child group.

parentGroupId.description: The unique identifier for the parent group within the group tree. If you're viewing group info for a root-level group, you may not see this member.

roleDescription.description: The human-readable description for a role.

roleName.description: The human-readable name for a role.

subGroups.description: Children of the parent group, represented as an array of `groupAccess` objects. Permissions cascade downward from parent to child unless the child group's `isBlocked` is `true`.

items.description: Children of the parent group, represented as an array of `groupAccess` objects. Permissions cascade downward from parent to child unless the child group's `isBlocked` is `true`.

identity.description: The API client. API clients contain a set of permissions and tokens, providing a user with access to specific APIs.

actions.description: Encapsulates the different ways you can edit an API client, such as changing its owner, changing its access rights to Control Center services or resources, or by deleting it.

deactivateAll.description: If the client's `deactivateAll` is `true`, you can deactivate all credentials for the API client at once. Otherwise, you need to deactivate the credentials individually.

delete.description: If `true`, you can delete the API client. Otherwise, contact an admin on your account to have them delete the client.

editAuth.description: If the client's `editAuth` is `true`,  you can change the client's group and role assignments, and which API services it can access.

lock.description: If the client's `lock` is `true`, you can lock the client to prevent anyone from using it to access services on Control Center.

transfer.description: If the client's `transfer` is `true`, you can give this API client to a different user.

activeCredentialCount.description: Number of credentials active for the API client.

allowAccountSwitch.description: If you can use the API client to manage more than one account.

createdBy.description: The user who created the API client.

createdDate.description: The date the API client was made.

openIdentityId.description: Unique identifier for an API client.

uiIdentityId.description: The unique identifier of the user the API client is being created for.

uiUserName.description: The human-readable username of the person who owns the API client.

useLunaUserAccess.description: If the API client's permissions are tied to a Control Center user's permissions.

parameters.description: A unique identifier for each API client.
parameters.name: openIdentityId

get.description: The response object contains the `accountSwitchKeys` and account names you can access based on the permissions of your API client. Once you have the `accountSwitchKeys` you need, [you can make an API call to another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client).

parameters.description: Optionally filter results by `accountId` or `accountName`. Enter at least three characters in the string to filter the results.
parameters.name: search

200.description: The response lists account switch keys.

schema.description: This object encapsulates a collection of contexts the open client can manage.

accountName.description: The name you supply for an account.

accountSwitchKey.description: The identifier for an account other than your API client's default.

parameters.description: A unique identifier for each API client.
parameters.name: openIdentityId

post.description: Create a new credential for an API client. Only the owner of an identity can create credentials for it.  Credentials are in `active` status at creation, and by  default expire two years from their creation date.  However, credentials expire differently when the API client is based on Control Center user permissions, and follow the same rotation schedule  listed for user passwords on those accounts. Run the [Update a credential](ref:put-identity-credential) operation to change the expiration date, description or status.  Save information from the response information like the `credentialID` for future use.  This is the only time you see the client secret. If you don't save it at this time, you'll need to create a new credential.

schema.description: Encapsulates all members for the credential data structure.

clientToken.description: Part of the credential that identifies the API client.

createdOn.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the credential was created.

expiresOn.description: ISO 8601 timestamp for when the credential expires. The default expiration date is two years from the creation date.

status.description: Whether a credential is `ACTIVE`, `INACTIVE`, or `DELETED`. Activating or deactivating the credential changes the value between `ACTIVE` and `INACTIVE`, but you can't reactivate any `DELETED` credentials.

parameters.description: Includes actions you can perform on the object, `false` by default.
parameters.name: actions

actions.description: Specifies activities available for the credential.

activate.description: Whether you can activate the credential.

deactivate.description: Whether you can deactivate the credential.

delete.description: Whether you can remove the credential.

editDescription.description: Whether you can modify the credential's description.

editExpiration.description: Whether you can modify the credential's expiration date.

clientToken.description: Part of the credential that identifies the API client.

createdOn.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the credential was created.

expiresOn.description: ISO 8601 timestamp for when the credential expires. The default expiration date is two years from the creation date.

maxAllowedExpiry.description: An ISO 8601 timestamp limit for credentials expiring.

status.description: Whether a credential is `ACTIVE`, `INACTIVE`, or `DELETED`. Activating or deactivating the credential changes the value between `ACTIVE` and `INACTIVE`, but you can't reactivate any `DELETED` credentials.

parameters.description: A unique identifier for each API client.
parameters.name: openIdentityId

post.description: Deactivate all credentials for an API client. This doesn't delete the API identity or the credentials. To deactivate a single credential, run the [Update a credential](ref:put-identity-credential) operation and set the status to `INACTIVE`.

parameters.description: Unique identifier for each credential. To get this value for your credentials, run the [List your credentials](ref:get-self-credentials) operation. For other users' credentials, run the [List credentials](ref:get-client-credentials) operation.
parameters.name: credentialId

parameters.description: A unique identifier for each API client.
parameters.name: openIdentityId

get.description: Get details for a single credential. Use [Update a credential](ref:put-identity-credential) to change the credential's expiration date, or toggle the credential's activation status.

parameters.description: Includes actions you can perform on the object, `false` by default.
parameters.name: actions

actions.description: Specifies activities available for the credential.

activate.description: Whether you can activate the credential.

deactivate.description: Whether you can deactivate the credential.

delete.description: Whether you can remove the credential.

editDescription.description: Whether you can modify the credential's description.

editExpiration.description: Whether you can modify the credential's expiration date.

clientToken.description: Part of the credential that identifies the API client.

createdOn.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the credential was created.

expiresOn.description: ISO 8601 timestamp for when the credential expires. The default expiration date is two years from the creation date.

maxAllowedExpiry.description: An ISO 8601 timestamp limit for credentials expiring.

status.description: Whether a credential is `ACTIVE`, `INACTIVE`, or `DELETED`. Activating or deactivating the credential changes the value between `ACTIVE` and `INACTIVE`, but you can't reactivate any `DELETED` credentials.

put.description: Edit credential details. You can change the expiration date, description, or toggle the activation status. This isn't the same as rotating a credential. For credential rotation, see [Rotate credentials](ref:rotate-credentials).

expiresOn.description: ISO 8601 timestamp for when the credential expires. The default expiration date is two years from the creation date.

status.description: Whether a credential is `ACTIVE`, `INACTIVE`, or `DELETED`. You can switch the status between `ACTIVE` and `INACTIVE`. You can't reactivate `DELETED` credentials.

actions.description: Specifies activities available for the credential.

activate.description: Whether you can activate the credential.

deactivate.description: Whether you can deactivate the credential.

delete.description: Whether you can remove the credential.

editDescription.description: Whether you can modify the credential's description.

editExpiration.description: Whether you can modify the credential's expiration date.

clientToken.description: Part of the credential that identifies the API client.

createdOn.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the credential was created.

expiresOn.description: ISO 8601 timestamp for when the credential expires. The default expiration date is two years from the creation date.

maxAllowedExpiry.description: An ISO 8601 timestamp limit for credentials expiring.

status.description: Whether a credential is `ACTIVE`, `INACTIVE`, or `DELETED`. Activating or deactivating the credential changes the value between `ACTIVE` and `INACTIVE`, but you can't reactivate any `DELETED` credentials.

delete.description: Delete a credential. You can only delete inactive credentials.

access-token-path.description: An access token identifies a collection of APIs belonging to an API client.
access-token-path.name: accessToken

actions-query.description: Includes actions you can perform on the object, `false` by default.
actions-query.name: actions

open-identity-id-path.description: A unique identifier for each API client.
open-identity-id-path.name: openIdentityId

search-query.description: Optionally filter results by `accountId` or `accountName`. Enter at least three characters in the string to filter the results.
search-query.name: search

credential-id-path.name: credentialId
